ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: striking sparks from their flashing hooves,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then those striking sparks of fire,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: then raise sparks of fire (by their hoofs),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Striking stones with their hooves, sparking fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then those that produce fire striking,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: striking sparks of fire with their hooves,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And striking off fire by dashing their hoofs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: by the strikers of sparks [with their hoofs],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Striking sparks of fire (by their hooves),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the producers of sparks [when] striking
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [100:2] by the strikers, the steeds that strike fire [by way], of sparks, with their hoofs, when they gallop across rocky terrain by night;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Striking sparks of fire) with their hooves, but this fire is as beneficial as the Fire of Abu Hubahib. The latter was one of the stingiest Arabs in camp. He never lit any fire to make bread for himself or for anyone else until everybody went to sleep, and whenever someone woke up he hurried to put the Fire out so that no one would benefit from it.
